initial_story:
Police have deployed an armoured vehicle to pry open the cabin of a lorry on a motorway in Texas.

The driver refused to stop, or get out of the cab when officers used spike strips to stop the vehicle, police said.

After the armoured vehicle tore open a window, police threw in a gas canister, before going inside and pulling the driver out.

It is unclear what started the chase, but police said the driver used "evasive manoeuvres", changing lanes multiple times and swerving.

“We still don’t know why he was acting in the erratic manner that he was,” Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez told journalists, adding that he appeared to have "some heavy impairment".
stories:
Firefighters have deployed a specialized unit to rescue a family trapped in a burning apartment complex in Florida.

The residents refused to evacuate, or leave the building when firefighters used a loudspeaker to warn them of the danger, authorities said.

After the unit blasted open a door, firefighters threw in a smoke mask, before going inside and leading the family to safety.

It is unclear what caused the fire, but firefighters said the residents used "desperate measures", frantically searching for belongings and hiding in closets.

"We still don't know why they were acting in the panicked manner that they were," Miami-Dade Fire Rescue Chief, Raquel Boss, told reporters, adding that they appeared to have "some severe disorientation".

Emergency responders rushed to a flooded neighborhood in Louisiana, where a family of four was trapped in their submerged home. Despite the urgent warnings, the residents refused to leave, clinging to their belongings and furniture. A specialized team used a crane to lift the roof, and then carefully extracted the family through a window. The cause of the flood was still unknown, but authorities reported that the family was in a state of "disbelieving shock", unable to comprehend the magnitude of the disaster.

Rescue teams descended upon a ravaged coastal town in Japan, where a group of elderly residents were stranded in their destroyed apartment complex. Despite the treacherous conditions, the seniors refused to evacuate, clinging to their cherished mementos and memories. A skilled team of engineers used heavy machinery to clear the rubble, and then delicately extracted the survivors through a makeshift entrance. The cause of the devastating typhoon was still being analyzed, but authorities reported that the residents were in a state of "bittersweet nostalgia", struggling to reconcile the loss of their home with the gratitude for their own survival.

Firefighters rushed to a charred mountain village in Greece, where a group of young families were trapped in their blackened chalets. Despite the acrid air and smoldering ruins, the parents refused to leave, holding onto the soot-stained photographs of their children and the memories of happier times. A team of experts used thermal imaging cameras to locate the survivors, and then carefully guided them out of the wreckage through a narrow escape route. The cause of the catastrophic wildfire was still under investigation, but authorities reported that the families were in a state of "resilient hope", struggling to come to terms with the destruction of their home and the gratitude for their own survival.
